#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A :
#Text=As President of a community association for 12 years , I saw the threats and challenges faced by one stable residential community .
#Text=They ranged from inappropriate and intrusive development to a property assessment system which resulted in unstable annual reassessments .
#Text=Through my colleagues , presidents of other community associations , I learned that the problems were not isolated in my community .
#Text=They were systemic across the ward , the City – and indeed , across the province .

#Text=I saw cases of unfair impact on homeowners who had previously believed that the Official Plan and the zoning by-law would protect their quiet enjoyment of their homes , apartments and their investment in the community .
#Text=In every case , I felt there were ways for governments – particularly Toronto City Council – to protect our stable residential communities .
#Text=In conversation and discussion with people in Ward 25 , I found it resonated .
#Text=Many people were and are impacted by inappropriate development .
#Text=People want a planning process which serves them .
#Text=I developed an election platform in 2003 around protection of our stable residential communities .

#Text=Once elected , I set out to implement it , against entrenched interests – with considerable success in many aspects , for example : Official Plan amendments , changes in the Committee of Adjustment , and new freedom for people to access previously withheld building permits .
#Text=There is more to do .
#Text=The new harmonized zoning by-law coming before Council will require provisions to close existing loopholes .
#Text=The planning process reform must be completed – to ensure that people are engaged earlier and meaningfully consulted on development applications in their community .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A :
#Text=My wife Liz and I have lived in Ward 25 for 21 years , raising our three sons , Neil , Scott and David here .
#Text=Ward 25 is a vibrant , wonderful place to live , work and enjoy life .
#Text=Ward 25 residents are proud and protective of their neighbourhoods .
#Text=Our employment areas on Leslie and Scarsdale and our commercial areas are thriving - but some are at risk from purchase and conversion to residential uses .
#Text=Our parks and natural areas are magnificent .
#Text=The ravines of the Don Valley are life-giving ribbons of green that benefit the entire City .
#Text=Ward 25 is a jewel in Toronto .
#Text=I want the best for it .
#Text=Q :
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A :
#Text=To be a conscientious Councillor is to be deeply involved in the community .
#Text=It requires very frequent attendance at local events and meetings .
#Text=It is critical for a Councillor to hear what people have to say about matters affecting their communities , about their hopes and desires for their communities .
#Text=I attend many evening meetings with ratepayer groups , with tenant groups , with school organizations and with other community groups .
#Text=Doing that is more than a full time job .
#Text=Consequently , I 've temporarily deferred most voluntary activity – particularly my long-time involvement in my own ratepayer association where I was President for twelve years .
#Text=I 've also been a junior boys ' baseball coach and junior boys ' curling team advisor .
#Text=My wife Liz , however , maintains her volunteer work .
#Text=For many years she was active in Home and School associations as our kids worked their way through school – serving as President from time to time .
#Text=As well , she was a volunteer for many years at Tennis Canada – rising to the position of Volunteer Co-ordinator for the annual men's/women 's Canadian Open Tennis Championship .
#Text=And now , she is a volunteer at Sunnybrook Hospital .
